title: Install add-on capabilities (Helm)
content:
The suite offers a Change feature that enables you to configure more capabilities to an already installed suite instance. These capabilities are referred to as add-ons, and they can be installed during or after the suite installation. You can install these add-ons using either OMT AppHub or command line interface, CLI.

The following table lists the add-on capabilities and their supported installation methods. 

Capability Description Notes Supported installation method
FinOps FinOps enables you to optimize your cloud spending and simplify configuration with various Cloud providers. With FinOps, you can review your public cloud costs to get a clearer understanding of your activity and usage of public cloud resources.
  • Optional for Service Management customers
  • Not applicable to SMA-SM customers
 AppHub and Command line interface
Cloud Carbon Footprint (Carbon) The Carbon Footprint capability is deprecated from version 26.1. Carbon aims to provide insights into your IT estate, enabling you to identify under/overconsumption and optimize capacity. To use the Cloud Carbon Footprint functionality, you need to first enable FinOps capability.
Hybrid Cloud Management (HCM)

The HCM capability enables customers to make new cloud service offerings based on published service designs available to consumers.

Before enabling and using the Design and Deploy functionality, you should install and enable Operations Orchestration (OO) Containerized capability. For more information, see Install OO on-premises and Enable OO Containerized in Suite Administration.
Software Asset Management (SAM) With the hardware and software data discovered by UD and license data retrieved from Service Management, the new SAM capability enables you to calculate and analyze license compliance for the software applications that you are using in your organization. This will reduce the risk of noncompliance and improve the visibility into your financial and operational decisions.
Service Portal for Service Manager (SPSM) Services required to integrate an external Service Manager system with the Service Portal.
  • Mandatory for SMA-SM customers
  • Optional for Service Management customers who want to additionally deploy one or more Service Manager tenants
 AppHub and Command line interface
Audit Collector

The Audit collector is a microservice that collects the audits from the NFS file system and passes them to the Audit service via REST. You can deploy the Audit collector using Helm charts.

This capability requires you to first enable the Audit service. For more details, see Enable Audit.

 Command line interface
Virtual Agent  End users can chat with the smart virtual agent in Service Portal in natural language. The smart virtual agent understands their intentions and finds the most matching intent predefined to provide either related answers or catalog offerings as responses. Command line interface

In addition, the following solution is available.

Solution Description Notes How to deploy
Native SACM A seamless data federation between the SACM module and UCMDB.
  • Optional for Service Management customers
  • Not applicable to SMA-SM customers
 Enable Native SACM

Add hardware resources

If the new capabilities require additional hardware resources, add the required hardware resources. For example, HCM and SAM require additional hardware resources. Refer to the sizing guide for your deployment platform (Embedded Kubernetes or Managed Kubernetes) for more information:

  • Plan the deployment (Embedded Kubernetes)
  • Sizing considerations for AWS with EKS deployment
  • Sizing considerations for Azure deployment

Prepare external databases if needed

If you plan to add a capability that requires a database, you must prepare an external database server for it if this is a production environment. Note that if your environment is using the internal PostgreSQL instance, you can't configure an external database server for the new capabilities (the database configuration screen will be bypassed).

Prepare a PostgreSQL database server

The FinOps, Carbon, HCM, and SAM capabilities require a PostgreSQL database server (SMPS doesn't need a database). You can either use an existing database server in your production environment or configure a new one. Refer to the installation instructions for your deployment platform (Embedded Kubernetes or Managed Kubernetes) if you want to use a new database server. 

Configure the pg_hba.conf file

Note: This step is needed only for on-premises and OpenShift deployments (not needed for AKS, EKS, or GCP deployment). 

  1. Add the lines in the following table to the pg_hba.conf file of the PostgreSQL database server (either the existing server being used in your environment or a new one) if you want to install SAM or DND. Note that 172.0.0.0/24 is an example value, which you need to replace with the IPv4 address range of the cluster nodes or a single cluster node's hostname. For more information, see Prepare external databases.
  2. Capability Lines in pg_hba.conf
    FinOps 
    host cgro cgro 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
host cgro <dba_user> 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
    Carbon 
    host carbon maas_admin 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
host carbon <dba_user> 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
    HCM 
    host dnd hcm_admin 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
host postgres hcm_admin 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
host dnd <dba_user> 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
    SAM 
    host sam sam 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
host sam <dba_user> 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256
host <dba_user> <dba_user> 172.0.0.0/24 scram-sha-256

    <dba_user> is the database administrator name of the PostgreSQL server. For example, postgres.

  3. Restart PostgreSQL. 

Prepare a Vertica database (for FinOps only)

If you plan to install FinOps, you need to install and configure a Vertica database. For details, see Install and configure a Vertica database.

Download and upload images

Skip this step if your registry already contains your add-on capability images. To download and upload images, see Download and upload required Images.

Install new capabilities

Use your preferred method to install any add-on needed for your deployment.

Install new capabilities using AppHub UI

Only applicable if you used OMT AppHub to install the suite.

  1.  Log in to AppHub as cluster administrator: https://<external_access_host>:<apphub-port>/apphub.
  2. Go to DEPLOYMENTS.
  3. Click the icon to open the menu, and click Edit , you will see all values that you configured in your previous deployment in the General, Capabilities, Database and Security sections. Review each category tab in the side menu to ensure that you have configured all the required parameters.
    • A tab with an icon indicates that one or more parameters are incomplete or invalid.
    • A tab with a check mark  icon indicates that all parameters are complete and valid.

      If you have already started to edit the deployment and saved a draft, the Edit menu item is replaced by View Settings, and a separate Drafts sub menu appears. Click View Settings to view the configuration of the current deployment, and click Edit Draft to continue editing the deployment

  4. Click Capabilities section to select the add-on capabilities you want to install.

    If you enable FinOps capabilities, you need to configure a Vertica database. See Configure Vertica Database.

  5. Click REDEPLOY.
  6. Once the image validation and helm dry run test is successful, the application update starts automatically.
  7. In the Health page, wait until the application status is running. 

    If the status is progressing, wait a few minutes for the process to be completed and updated to running. You can monitor the pod status from the user interface.

Install new capabilities using CLI

Get your my-values.yaml file

Run the following commands on the bastion to get your my-values.yaml file in the current suite environment. 

ns=<ESM_NAMESPACE>
releaseName=`helm list -n $ns | grep esm | awk '{print $1}'`
helm get values $releaseName -n $ns > my-values.yaml

where <ESM_NAMESPACE>: is the unique namespace of the ESM deployment.

Add add-on capabilities parameters to my-values.yaml

Update your my-values.yaml according to the capabilities you wish to enable. The tables below describe the parameters and their required values for each capability.

  • To enable FinOps capability:
    Parameters Description Required
    global.services.cmp Possible values: true/false, Default value: true yes
    global.services.dnd Possible values: true/false, Default value: true yes
    global.services.cgro Possible values: true/false, Default value: true yes
    global.services.carbon Set it to true if you want to enable Cloud Carbon Footprint. optional
    global.vertica.host The FQDN of the Vertica server. yes
    global.vertica.port External Vertica port for both TLS enabled and non-TLS. The default value is 5433. yes
    global.vertica.dbName Vertica database name. The default value is cgro. yes
    global.vertica.rwuser DB User with READ and WRITE Permissions. The default value is dbadmin. yes
    global.vertica.tlsEnabled Possible values: true/false, Default value: true yes
    vertica.caCertificates Vertica database server certificates. Needed if you enabled tls connection. optional
    secrets.verticaDbPassword Database Password for Vertica yes
  • To enable Hybrid Cloud Management capability:
    Parameters Description Required
    global.services.cmp Possible values: true/false, Default value: true yes
    global.services.dnd Possible values: true/false, Default value: true yes
  • To enable Software Asset Management (SAM) capability
    Parameters Description Required
    global.services.sam Possible values: true/false, Default value: true yes
  • To enable Service Portal for Service Manager capability
    parameters Description Required
    global.services.smGateway Possible values: true/false, Default value: false yes
    global.services.smChat Possible values: true/false, Default value: false yes
  • To enable Audit Collector capability

    To enable Audit collector, ensure you have already enabled Audit service. For more details, see Enable Audit.

    parameters Description Required
    global.services.auditCollector Possible values: true/false, Default value: false yes
    auditCollector.auditCollector.auditengine.url The audit engine URL: https://<Audit FQDN:Audit engine port>/audit-service-engine. You don't have to give the audit engine port if the port is 443. Yes
    auditCollector.auditCollector.idm.integrationUser The user that's used to send audit to the Audit service. This user can be the same as the Audit producer's integration user. This user should be a part of the administrator group of sysbo in IdM. Set the password for this user to never expire. Yes
    auditCollector.auditCollector.idm.integrationUserOrgName The organization that the integration user belongs to. Yes
  • To enable Virtual Agent (VA) capability
    parameters Description Required
    global.services.va Possible values: true/false, Default value: false yes

Perform add-on capability installation

After editing your my-values.yaml file with the capabilities you wish to install, use the following steps to complete the add-on capability installation.

  1. Run the following command to install the add-on capabilities 
    ns=<ESM_NAMESPACE>
releaseName=`helm list -n $ns | grep esm | awk '{print$1}'`
helm upgrade $releaseName <ESM_CHART_FILE> --namespace $ns -f <VALUES_YAML_FILE>

    where:

    • <ESM_NAMESPACE> is the unique namespace of the ESM deployment.
    • <ESM_CHART_FILE> is the tar file containing the ESM installation charts.
    • <VALUES_YAML_FILE> is your custom my-values.yaml file with properties configured for the ESM deployment. 
  2. Run the following command to make sure all suite pods are ready. 
    kubectl get pod -n <ESM_NAMESPACE> |grep -v 1/1|grep -v 2/2|grep -v 3/3|grep -v 4/4|grep -v Completed

    where: <ESM_NAMESPACE> is the unique namespace of the ESM deployment.

Configure the newly added capabilities

FinOps

For details, see Enable CMP FinOps.

Carbon

For details, see Measure your carbon footprint.

Hybrid Cloud Management

The HCM option only installs the HCM controller service. Once HCM is installed, you need to deploy and enable HCM at the tenant level. For details, see Enable DND.

Software Asset Management (SAM)

The SAM option installs the SAM Server and SAM UI services. Once SAM is installed, you need to deploy and enable SAM at the tenant level. For details, see Enable SAM. 

Virtual Agent(VA)

For more details, see Smart virtual agent settings.
